gurmukhi: pMfu pu`qR kur rwj Bin bhur Anuj pdu dyhu ]suq aucwir AMq Air aucir nwm bwn lK lyhu ]176]
transliteration: Pand(u) Pouttra Kur Raaj Bhan(i) Anuj Pad(u) Deh(u)|| Sout Oucdaar(i) Ant Ar(i) Ouchar (i) Naam Baan Lakh Leh(u)||176||
translation: After uttering the words “Pandu-Putra and Kururaaj”, then adding the word “Anuj” and afterwards saying the ward “Sut and ari”, the names of Baan are spoken.176

gurmukhi: jaUiDStr BImwgR Bin ArjnwgR puin BwK ]suiq Awid AMq Air aucir nwm bwnu liK rwKu ]177]
transliteration: Jaoodhishtar Bheemaagra Bhan(i) Arjanaagra Poun(i) Bhaakh|| Sout Aadh Ant Ar(i) Ouchar(i) Naam Baan(u) Lakh(i) Raakh(u)||177||
translation: After uttering the words “Yudhishtar and Bhimaagra”, then adding “Arjunagara” and afterwards saying “Sut and ari” at end, the names of Baan are known.177.

gurmukhi: nukl bMDu sihdyv Anuj kih pd bMD aucwr ]suq Awid AMq Air aucru sr ky nwm ibcwr ]178]
transliteration: Noukal Bandh(u) Saihdev Anuj Kah(i) Pad Bandh Ouchaar|| Soot Aadh Ant Ar(i) Ouchar(u) Sar Ke Naam Bichaar||178||
translation: Saying the wards “Bandhu and Sut-ari” after uttering the words “Nakul, Sahdev and Anuj”, the names of Baan are known.178.

gurmukhi: jwg syin ko piRQm kih piq pd bhur aucwr ]Anuj Awid sUqwNq Air sB sru nwm Apwr ]179]
transliteration: Jaag Sen(i) Ko Pritham Kah(i) Pat(i) Pad Bahur Ouchaar|| Anuj Aadh Sootaant Ar(i) Sabh Sar(u) Naam Apaar||179||
translation: Uttering primarily the word “Yaagyasen” (Daraupadi) and then saying the words “Pati, Anuj and Sutant-ari”, many names of baan are known.179.

gurmukhi: piRQm dRopqI dRupqjw aucir supiq pd dyhu ]Anuj aucir sUqir aucir nwm bwn lK lyhu ]180]
transliteration: Pritham Dropatidrouptajaa Ouchar(i) Soupat(i) Pad Deh(u)|| Anuj Ouchar(i) Sootar(i) Ouchar(i) Naam Baan Lakh Leh(u)||180||
translation: Uttering primarily the words “Draupadi and Drupadja” and then saying “Supati, Anuj and Sutari”, the names of Baan are known.180.

gurmukhi: DiRSt dRumnjw piRQm kih puin piq Sbd bKwn ]Anuj aucir sUqir aucir nwm bwn ky jwn ]181]
transliteration: Dhrishat Droumanjaa Pritham Kah(i) Poun(i) Pat(i) Shabad Bakhaan|| Anuj Ouchar(i) Sootar(i) Ouchar(i) Naam Baan Kejaan||181||
translation: Saying primarily the word Dharishdayumanja”, then adding the words “Pati and Anuj” and afterwards saying “Sutari”, the names of Baan are known.181.

gurmukhi: dRupq dRox irpu piRQm kih jwkih piq puin BwK ]Anuj aucir sUqir aucir nwm bwn lK rwK ]182]
transliteration: Droupat Dron Rip(u) Pritham Kah(i) Jaakah(i) Pat(i) Poun(i) Bhaakh|| Anuj Ouchar(i) Sootar(i) Ouchar(i) Naam Baan Lakh Raakh||182||
translation: Uttering the words Drupad and Dron-ripu”, then adding the word “Ja” and afterwards saying the words “Pati, Anuj and Sutari” many names of Baan are known.182.

gurmukhi: piRQm nwm lY dRupq ko jwmwqw puin BwK ]Anuj aucir sUqir aucir nwm bwn lK rwK ]183]
transliteration: Pritham Naam Lai Droupat Ko Jaamaataa Poun(i) Bhaakh|| Anuj Ouchar(i) Sootar(i) Ouchar(i) Naam Baan Lakh Raakh||183||
translation: Uttering the name Drupad in the beginning and then saying the words “Jamata, Anuj and Sutari”, many names of Baan are known.183.

gurmukhi: piRQm dRox kO kwm lY Air pd bhur aucwr ]BgnI kih piq BRwq kih sUqir bwn ibcwr ]184]
transliteration: Pritham Dron Kau Kaam Lai Ar(i) Pad Bahur Ouchaar|| Bhagnikah(i) Pat(i) Bhraat Kah(i) Sootar(i) Baan Bichar||184||
translation: Uttering the name "Dron”, adding “Ari” and then saying the words “Bhagini, Pati, Bharaat and Sutari”, the names of Baan are known.184.

gurmukhi: Asur rwj S`qRwNq kr ibsK bwrhw bwn ]dwrwpd duStwNq kr nwm qIr ky jwn ]185]
transliteration: Asur Raaj Shattraant Kar Bisakh Baar-haa Baan|| Daaraapad Doushtaant Kar Naam Teer Ke Jaan||185||
translation: The destroyer of Ravana, the enemy of Indra, the ripper of he clouds and the perisher of all kinds of adversities is called by the name of TIR (Baan).185.

gurmukhi: mwdRI Sbd piRQmy kho suq bhur bKwn ]A`gR Anuj sUqir aucir sr ky nwm pCwn ]186]
transliteration: Maadrishabad Prithme Kaho Sout Pad Bahur Bakhaan|| Aggra Anuj Sootar(i) Ouchar(i) Sar Ke Naam Pachhaad||186||
translation: Uttering primarily the word "Maaadra", then saying the word "Sut" then adding the words "Anuj and Satari", the names of Baan are recognised.186.

gurmukhi: sugRIv ko piRQm kih Air pd bhur bKwn ]skl nwm sRI bwn ky lIjhu cqur pCwn ]187]
transliteration: Sougreev Ko Pritham Kah(i) Ar(i) Pad Bahur Bakhaan|| Sakal Naam Sribaan Ke Leejoh Chatur Pachhaad||187||
translation: Uttering primarily the word “Sugriva”, then adding the word “Ari” the wise people recognize all the names of Baan.187.

gurmukhi: ds gRIv ds kMT Bin Air pd bhuir aucwr ]skl nwm eyh bwn ky lIjhu cqur suDwr ]188]
transliteration: Das Greev Das Kanth Bhan(i) Ar(i) Pad Bahur(i) Ouchaar|| Sakal Naam Eh Baan Ke Leejoh Chatur Sudhaar||188||
translation: Uttering the words “Dasgriva and Daskanth”, then saying the word “Ari”, the wise people correctly known the names of Baan.188.

gurmukhi: piRQm jtwXu bKwn kY Air pd bhur bKwn ]irpu pd bhuir aucwrIAY sr ky nwm pCwn ]189]
transliteration: Pritham Jataayu Bakhaan Kai Ar(i) Pad Bahur Bakhaan|| Rip(u) Pad Bahur(i) Oucdareeai Sar Ke Naam Pachhaad||189||
translation: Uttering primarily the word Jataayoo and then and then adding the words “Ari and Ripu”, the names of Baan are recognized.189.
